        Parameters:

      • bindingstoString

      • bindFormula

        public java.util.Queue<VarsValues> bindFormula(org.antlr.v4.runtime.tree.ParseTree body,
                                               java.util.Queue<VarsValues> preBinds)
        Parameters:
        body - body of a rule. it's of formula type
        preBinds - previous bindings passed to next formula. used in conjunction, disjunction, existential and external formulas. previous bindings is a list of maps between variables and their values. list is updated in next subformulas of And, Or, Exists External. following is an example (from W3C RIF-BLD web page): Forall ?item ?deliverydate ?scheduledate ?diffduration ?diffdays ( cpt:reject( ?item) :- And(cpt:perishable(?item) cpt:delivered(?item ?deliverydate ) cpt:scheduled(?item ?scheduledate) ?diffduration = External(func:subtract-dateTimes(?deliverydate ?scheduledate)) ?diffdays = External(func:days-from-duration(?diffduration)) External(pred:numeric-greater-than(?diffdays 10))) or rule: Forall ?item ( cpt:reject( ?item ) :- Exists ?deliverydate ?scheduledate ?diffduration ?diffdays ( And(cpt:perishable(?item) cpt:delivered(?item ?deliverydate ) cpt:scheduled(?item ?scheduledate) ?diffduration = External(func:subtract-dateTimes(?deliverydate ?scheduledate)) ?diffdays = External(func:days-from-duration(?diffduration)) External(pred:numeric-greater-than(?diffdays 10))) ) ) | {milk, fruit} deliverableDate | {NOV 12, NOV 15} ... | ...
        Returns:
        return the binding of variables between the body of a rule and all facts in knowledge base (as a map).

      • bindHead

        public java.util.List<RIFBLDParser.AtomicContext> bindHead(RIFBLDParser.AtomicContext head,
                                                           java.util.Queue<VarsValues> bindings)
        Parameters:
        ac - atomic clause in head
        bindings - variable bindings. each variable has a value bound to it.
        Returns:
        returns a new fact by bindings variables in the atomic clause (of head of a rule) with values from the bindings list

      • tokens2String

        public java.lang.String tokens2String(java.util.Queue<java.lang.String> tokens)
        Because queue.toString() does not return the desired result as an input to ANTLR input stream,this method is used. converts a queue of token strings to a string. it puts an space between each token.
        Parameters:
        tokens - a queue contains token strings
        Returns:
        returns a string representation of the queue argument

      • addNewFacts

        public void addNewFacts(java.util.Queue<VarsValues> bindings,

        Adds new (inferred) facts to the KB
        Parameters:
        bindingsCopy - queue of new facts
        group - parent of facts and rules in KB parse tree
